intro: Sphaeromeria capitata, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescence composed of numerous small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from yellow to orange. Sphaeromeria capitata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is well adapted to arid environments.
